newsitem.title: USA: Virginia has $225 million surplus for fiscal 1997.
newsitem.headline: Virginia has $225 million surplus for fiscal 1997.

text.p: Virginia ended its fiscal year June 30 with a budget surplus of $225 million, state officials said.

Budget analysts attributed the surplus to stronger than expected personal and business income tax collections. They had predicted collections would rise by 5.4 percent over the previous year. The acutal increase was 8.1 percent.
About $120 million of the surplus will go into the state's rainy day fund, boosting the fund to $330 million.
